intro: Hieracium brunneocroceum, commonly known as the brownish yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive brownish hue, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium brunneocroceum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
